articles.author: Clare Jim
articles.title: Dozens arrested after Hong Kong protest taking aim at Chinese traders
articles.description: Scuffles erupted between police and protesters in Hong Kong on Sunday, with dozens of arrests made, after thousands marched near the border, shouting pro-democracy slogans and venting their anger at mainland Chinese traders.
articles.content:
HONG KONG (Reuters) - Scuffles erupted between police and protesters in Hong Kong on Sunday, with dozens of arrests made, after thousands marched near the border, shouting pro-democracy slogans and venting their anger at mainland Chinese traders. 
The demons… [+3319 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Six German tourists killed by suspected drunk driver in Italy
articles.description: Six German tourists were killed on Sunday after a suspected drunk driver crashed into a group of people in a town in northern Italy, police said.
articles.content:
MILAN (Reuters) - Six German tourists were killed on Sunday after a suspected drunk driver crashed into a group of people in a town in northern Italy, police said. 
Eleven other people were injured, some seriously, in the incident which happened in the early… [+466 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: UK's Raab says U.S. had right of self defense in Soleimani killing
articles.description: The United States had a right to self defense in killing Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani, British foreign minister Dominic Raab said on Sunday.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - The United States had a right to self defense in killing Iranian military commander Qassem Soleimani, British foreign minister Dominic Raab said on Sunday. 
Soleimani, the architect of Tehran’s overseas clandestine and military operations … [+581 chars]

articles.title: Austria suspects foreign state behind cyberattack on ministry
articles.description: Austria suspects a foreign country is behind a serious cyberattack on information systems at its Foreign Ministry that continued on Sunday, the ministry said.
articles.content:
ZURICH (Reuters) - Austria suspects a foreign country is behind a serious cyberattack on information systems at its Foreign Ministry that continued on Sunday, the ministry said.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Iraq parliament to convene amid calls to expel U.S. troops
articles.description: Iraq's parliament is set to convene an extraordinary session on Sunday where lawmakers told Reuters they would push for a vote on a resolution requiring the government to request the withdrawal of U.S. troops from Iraq.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Iraq’s parliament is set to convene an extraordinary session on Sunday where lawmakers told Reuters they would push for a vote on a resolution requiring the government to request the withdrawal of U.S. troops from Iraq. 
The session comes… [+1849 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. lacks courage for military confrontation with Iran: Iran army chief
articles.description: The United States lacks the courage for military confrontation with Iran, the Islamic Republic's army chief said on Sunday, according to state TV.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - The United States lacks the courage for military confrontation with Iran, the Islamic Republic’s army chief said on Sunday, according to state TV.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Iran's minister Jahromi says Trump is "a terrorist in a suit": tweet
articles.description: The United States President Donald Trump is "a terrorist in a suit", Iranian Information and Telecommunications Minister Mohammad Javad Azari-Jahromi tweeted on Sunday.
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - The United States President Donald Trump is “a terrorist in a suit”, Iranian Information and Telecommunications Minister Mohammad Javad Azari-Jahromi tweeted on Sunday. 
“Like ISIS, Like Hitler, Like Genghis! They all hate cultures. Trump i… [+193 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: UK foreign minister Raab spoke to Iraqi leaders to urge deescalation of tensions
articles.description: British foreign minister Dominic Raab said on Sunday he had spoken to Iraq's prime minister and president to urge a deescalation of tensions in the region following the killing of a top Iranian military commander by the United States.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - British foreign minister Dominic Raab said on Sunday he had spoken to Iraq’s prime minister and president to urge a deescalation of tensions in the region following the killing of a top Iranian military commander by the United States.
